original: KÖNSBERG, Nils Allan, Konsul, Malmö, f Törnevalla, östergötl, 13/3 78, gm Martha 291 KÖRDEI* Lauenstein. Eft slut skolgång o prakt i järn-varubranschen anst ss reseomb i AB Sv Metallverken i Västerås 09, chef f bolagets Mal-mö-kont 14—43. Finsk konsul sed. 19. Har verksamt bidragit till tillk av Frostavallen. RNO, RVO, FinlFrK, FinlVROlkl, ProPstGM, Skidfrämj JM. Hobbies: Friluftsliv, skidlöpning.
translated: KÖNSBERG, Nils Allan, Consul, Malmö, born in Törnevalla, östergötl, on March 13, 1878, married Martha in 1891 in Lauenstein. After completing his education and gaining practical experience in the iron and hardware industry, he was employed as a traveling salesman for AB Sv Metallverken in Västerås in 1909. He became the head of the company's Malmö office from 1914 to 1943. He served as the Finnish Consul since 1919. He significantly contributed to the development of Frostavallen. He received the Royal Norwegian Order of St. Olav, the Royal Swedish Order of Vasa, the Finnish Order of the White Rose, the Finnish Order of the Cross of Liberty, the Provincial Grand Master of Freemasonry, and was a Promotion member of Skidfrämjande JM (a skiing organization). Hobbies: Outdoor life, skiing.

structured.name: Nils Allan Könsberg
